claim_note: Truck rear-ended a passenger vehicle on the highway. Driver stated he tried to brake but traffic slowed suddenly. No injuries reported. Light rain at the time. Passenger vehicle had rear bumper damage.
Driver drifted out of lane and sideswiped a box truck. Insured admitted he was checking his phone for directions. No injuries. Damage to right side mirror and panel.
Vehicle lost control on curve and struck guardrail. Driver reported being fatigued after 12 hours on duty. No passengers. Tow required.
Third party alleged insured changed lanes aggressively and clipped the rear bumper of their SUV. Insured denied and claimed the SUV was speeding. Minor damage. No injuries.
Truck struck debris on roadway causing tire blowout. Driver maintained control but trailer swayed and damaged cargo inside. No collision with other vehicles. No injuries.
Insured’s parked vehicle was hit by unknown party overnight. No witnesses. Damage to left front fender. Police report filed.

Insured driver reported rear-ending a small sedan while approaching a red light. Driver stated that the roads were wet due to light rain and visibility was reduced. No injuries reported. The sedan driver complained of minor bumper damage. Insured admitted he was distracted adjusting the GPS.

Truck driver swerved to avoid debris on the highway and struck the guardrail. Load shifted during maneuver, causing additional damage to the trailer. No other vehicles involved. Driver had been on duty for 9 hours at the time of incident. No injuries reported.

Insured vehicle was sideswiped while merging onto I-75. Third party stated insured merged abruptly without signaling. Insured claims blind spot and heavy traffic made it difficult to see. Minor damage to left rear door. No injuries on either side.

Driver lost control on icy bridge surface and collided with median. EMS called but no injuries. Vehicle sustained moderate front-end damage. Incident occurred at 6:20 AM before sunrise. Driver stated he was traveling under the speed limit but sudden ice caused skidding.

Delivery van struck a parked car while backing into a narrow driveway. Insured stated the backup camera was fogged due to condensation. No injuries. Parked vehicle owner not present at the scene. Photographs taken and police report filed.

Three-vehicle accident at intersection. Third party 1 reports insured ran a red light. Insured states the light turned yellow and he attempted to clear the intersection. Third party 2 struck the insured’s rear quarter panel during the chain reaction. Minor injuries reported by third party 1.

Insured semi-truck experienced brake fade descending mountain grade. Driver used runaway ramp to stop vehicle safely. Trailer sustained undercarriage damage from gravel. No collision with other vehicles. Driver reported fatigue after long shift.

Vehicle hydroplaned during heavy rain and collided with SUV in adjacent lane. Both parties exchanged information. Two passengers in SUV complained of neck stiffness but refused EMS transport. Insured stated poor drainage on roadway contributed to the incident.

Insured reported theft from parked truck overnight. Tools and equipment valued at approx. $3,000 missing. No signs of forced entry. Surveillance footage from nearby business is being reviewed. No injuries involved.

While making a left turn, insured struck a bicyclist who was traveling in the crosswalk. Bicyclist experienced minor leg injury and was transported for evaluation. Insured stated sun glare prevented him from seeing the cyclist. Police cited insured for failure to yield.
